Extract model coefficients from a mable

Source: R/broom.R
tidy.Rd

This function will obtain the coefficients (and associated statistics) for each model in the mable.

# S3 method for mdl_df
tidy(x, ...)

# S3 method for mdl_df
coef(object, ...)

# S3 method for mdl_ts
tidy(x, ...)

# S3 method for mdl_ts
coef(object, ...)

Arguments

x, object

A mable.
...

Arguments for model methods.

Examples

if (requireNamespace("fable", quietly = TRUE)) {
library(fable)
library(tsibbledata)

olympic_running %>%
  model(lm = TSLM(log(Time) ~ trend())) %>%
  tidy()
}
#> # A tibble: 56 x 9
#>    Length Sex   .model term      .response estimate std.error statistic  p.value
#>     <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <chr>        <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1    100 men   lm     (Interce… Time      11.1       0.0913    122.    2.06e-37
#>  2    100 men   lm     trend()   Time      -0.0504    0.00481   -10.5   7.88e-11
#>  3    100 men   lm     (Interce… log(Time)  2.41      0.0913     26.4   2.58e-20
#>  4    100 men   lm     trend()   log(Time) -0.00482   0.00481    -1.00  3.26e- 1
#>  5    100 women lm     (Interce… Time      12.4       0.163      75.7   4.93e-25
#>  6    100 women lm     trend()   Time      -0.0567    0.00752    -7.55  3.94e- 7
#>  7    100 women lm     (Interce… log(Time)  2.52      0.163      15.4   3.38e-12
#>  8    100 women lm     trend()   log(Time) -0.00501   0.00752    -0.667 5.13e- 1
#>  9    200 men   lm     (Interce… Time      22.3       0.140     159.    4.17e-39
#> 10    200 men   lm     trend()   Time      -0.0995    0.00726   -13.7   3.89e-13
#> # … with 46 more rows
